entries.meaning: A button or other mechanism for rewinding.
examples: I meant to pause the picture, but hit the rewind by mistake.

verbs.description: rewind (third-person singular simple present rewinds, present participle rewinding, simple past and past participle rewound)

examples: […]  she was winding and rewinding bandages that were dripping in blood, smiling strangely at her as the plasma spilled from buckets all over the floor.

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To wind (something) back, now especially of cassette or video tape, CD, DVD etc.; to go back on a video or audio recording.
(figurative) To go back or think back to a previous moment or place, or a previous point in a discourse.
